title: Evidence grows for CTE as a dementia cause
summary: A landmark brain study suggests severe CTE should be formally recognized alongside Alzheimer’s as a cause of dementia. Dementia diagnosis is often marked by small losses. Memory lapses, confusion, an unshakable feeling that something is wrong. When clarity arrives, it is frequently framed as Alzheimer’s disease.
